verses.text: Concerning the Ammonites, thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Hath Israel no sons? Hath he no heir? Why \add then\add* doth their king inherit Gad, And his people dwell in his cities?

Therefore behold, the days come, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, That I will cause an alarm of war to be heard in Rabbah of the Ammonites; And it shall be a desolate heap, And her daughters shall be burnt with fire: Then shall Israel be heir unto them that were his heirs, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.

Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is spoiled: Cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird ye with sackcloth; Lament, and run to and fro by the hedges; For their king shall go into captivity, \add And\add* his priests and his princes together.
Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys, Thy flowing valley, O backsliding daughter? That trusted in her treasures, \add saying\add*, Who shall come unto me?

Behold, I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the Lord \sc God\sc* of hosts, From all those that be about thee; And ye shall be driven out every man right forth; And none shall gather up him that wandereth.
And afterward I will bring again the captivity of the children of Ammon, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Concerning Edom, thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts; \add Is\add* wisdom no more in Teman? Is counsel perished from the prudent? Is their wisdom vanished?
Flee ye, turn back, Dwell deep, O inhabitants of Dedan; For I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, The time \add that\add* I will visit him.
If grapegatherers come to thee, would they not leave \add some\add* gleaning grapes? If thieves by night, they will destroy till they have enough.
But I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, And he shall not be able to hide himself: His seed is spoiled, and his brethren, and his neighbours, and he \add is\add* not.
Leave thy fatherless children, I will preserve \add them\add* alive; And let thy widows trust in me.

For thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Behold, they whose judgment \add was\add* not to drink of the cup have assuredly drunken; And \add art\add* thou he \add that\add* shall altogether go unpunished? Thou shalt not go unpunished, but thou shalt surely drink \add of it\add*.
For I have sworn by myself, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, That Bozrah shall become a desolation, A reproach, a waste, and a curse; And all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes.
I have heard a rumour from the \sc Lord\sc*, And an ambassador \add is\add* sent unto the heathen, \add saying\add*, Gather ye together, And come against her, and rise up to the battle.
For lo, I will make thee small among the heathen, \add And\add* despised among men.

Thy terribleness hath deceived thee, \add and\add* the pride of thine heart, O thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, That holdest the height of the hill: Though thou shouldest make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from thence, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Also Edom shall be a desolation: Every one that goeth by it shall be astonished, And shall hiss at all the plagues thereof.
As \add in\add* the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah And the neighbour \add cities\add* thereof, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, No man shall abide there, Neither shall a son of man dwell in it.

Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan Against the habitation of the strong: But I will suddenly make him run away from her: And who \add is\add* a chosen \add man, that\add* I may appoint over her? For who \add is\add* like me? and who will appoint me the time? And who \add is\add* that shepherd that will stand before me?

Therefore hear the counsel of the \sc Lord\sc*, That he hath taken against Edom; And his purposes, that he hath purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out: Surely he shall make their habitations desolate with them.
The earth is moved at the noise of their fall, \add At\add* the cry, the noise thereof was heard in the Red sea.
Behold, he shall come up and fly as the eagle, And spread his wings over Bozrah: And at that day shall the heart of the mighty \add men\add* of Edom Be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
Concerning Damascus. Hamath is confounded, and Arpad: For they have heard evil tidings: they are fainthearted; \add There is\add* sorrow on the sea; it cannot be quiet.
Damascus is waxed feeble, \add and\add* turneth herself to flee, And fear hath seized on \add her:\add* Anguish and sorrows have taken her, as a woman in travail.
How is the city of praise not left, The city of my joy!
Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, And all the men of war shall be cut off in that day, Saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, And it shall consume the palaces of Ben-hadad.
Concerning Kedar, and concerning the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon shall smite, thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Arise ye, go up to Kedar, And spoil the men of the east.

Their tents and their flocks shall they take \add away:\add* They shall take to themselves their curtains, And all their vessels, and their camels; And they shall cry unto them, Fear \add is\add* on every side.
Flee, get you far off, dwell deep, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, Saith the \sc Lord\sc*; For Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath taken counsel against you, And hath conceived a purpose against you.
Arise, get you up unto the wealthy nation, That dwelleth without care, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Which have neither gates nor bars, \add which\add* dwell alone.

And their camels shall be a booty, And the multitude of their cattle a spoil: And I will scatter into all winds them \add that are\add* in the utmost corners; And I will bring their calamity from all sides thereof, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
And Hazor shall be a dwelling for dragons, \add And\add* a desolation for ever: There shall no man abide there, Nor \add any\add* son of man dwell in it.
The word of the \sc Lord\sc* that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts; Behold, I \add will\add* break the bow of Elam, The chief of their might.
And upon Elam will I bring the four winds From the four quarters of heaven, And will scatter them towards all those winds; And there shall be no nation Whither the outcasts of Elam shall not come.

For I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, And before them that seek their life: And I will bring evil upon them, \add Even\add* my fierce anger, saith the \sc Lord\sc*; And I will send the sword after them, Till I have consumed them:
And I will set my throne in Elam, And will destroy from thence the king and the princes, Saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
But it shall come to pass in the latter days, \add That\add* I will bring again the captivity of Elam, Saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
